attributes.description:
Users may OPTIONALLY include a single field for clustering within AnnData files, or multiple fields denoting clustering, e.g. different clustering algorithms, multiple resolutions of clustering, etc.

We therefore REQUIRE that clustering is clearly denoted within the AnnData file if it contains clustering fields.

ScanPy has set an AnnData community standard of defining the `*.obs` value by the type of algorithm. e.g. the function `scanpy.tl.louvain` (documented [here](https://scanpy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/generated/scanpy.tl.louvain.html)) by default saves the clustering as `anndata.obs['louvain']`. Similarly, `leiden` (documented [here](https://scanpy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/generated/scanpy.tl.leiden.html)) is often encoded as `anndata.obs['leiden']`.
attributes.name: obs.{cluster}
attributes.title: Clustering
attributes.values:
_Column Name_ The column name is `cluster`, `leiden`, `louvain` or `cluster + _ + [ALGORITHM_TYPE] + _ + [SUFFIX]` whereby [ALGORITHM_TYPE] and [SUFFIX] are OPTIONAL. * `cluster`, `leiden` or `louvain`: MUST be used to denote clustering in AnnData.obs * [ALGORITHM]: Denotes the algorithm used, e.g. be either `leiden` or `louvain`. OPTIONAL. * [SUFFIX]: Denotes a descriptive tag informative enough for third-party users; used to distinguish between multiple clusterings. OPTIONAL
Example field names: `cluster_leiden`, `cluster_leiden_broad`, `louvain`, `leiden_fine`. _Cluster_ Integer of cluster label.

attributes.description:
The string specified by the user for `[cellannotation_setname]` will be used as the pandas DataFrame column name (key) to encode the following cell annotation metadata columns in `*.obs`.

NOTE: A dataset may have multiple sets of cell annotations each with a corresponding set of cell annotation metadata, e.g. `'cell_type'` and `'broadclustering_celltype'`.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}
attributes.title: Cell Annotation Set Name
attributes.values:
_Column Name_

The column name is the string`[cellannotation_setname]` and the values are the strings of `cell_label`. Refer to the fields `cellannotation_setname` and `cell_label` in the JSON Schema.

_Set Name_

Any free-text term which the author uses to annotate cells, the preferred cell label name used by the author.

attributes.description:
The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'cell_fullname'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'cell_fullname'`

For example, if the user specified the cell annotation as `broad_cells1`, then the name of the column in the pandas DataFrame will be `broad_cells1--cell_fullname`.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--cell_fullname
attributes.title: Cell Full Name
attributes.values: The full-length name for the biological entity listed in `[cellannotation_setname]` by the author.

attributes.description: The column name is the string prefix `[cellannotation_setname]--` concatenated with the string value `cell_ontology_exists`, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'cell_ontology_exists'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--cell_ontology_exists
attributes.title: Cell Ontology Exists
attributes.values: Boolean value in Python (either True or False).

attributes.description: The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'cell_ontology_term_id'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'cell_ontology_term_id'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--cell_ontology_term_id
attributes.title: Cell Ontology Term ID
attributes.values: This MUST be a term from either the Cell Ontology or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology e.g. the Provisional Cell Ontology or the Drosophila Anatomy Ontology (DAO).

attributes.description: The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'cell_ontology_term'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'cell_ontology_term'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--cell_ontology_term
attributes.title: Cell Ontology Term
attributes.values: The human-readable name associated with the `cell_ontology_term_id`.

attributes.description: The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'rationale'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'rationale'`
attributes.example: This cell was annotated with [blank] given the canonical markers in the field [X], [Y], [Z]. We noticed [X] and [Y] running differential expression.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--rationale
attributes.title: Rationale

attributes.description: The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'rationale_dois'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'rationale_dois'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--rationale_dois
attributes.title: Rationale DOIs
attributes.values: Comma-separated string of valid publication DOIs cited by the author to support or provide justification/evidence/context for `cell_label`.

attributes.description:
The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'marker_gene_evidence'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'marker_gene_evidence'`

For example, if the user specified the cell annotation as `broad_cells1`, then the name of the column in the pandas DataFrame will be `broad_cells1--marker_gene_evidence`.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--marker_gene_evidence
attributes.title: Marker Gene Evidence
attributes.values: Comma-separated string of HGNC gene names explicitly used as evidence for this cell annotation. Each gene MUST be included in the matrix of the AnnData/Seurat file.

attributes.description:
The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'canonical_marker_genes'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'canonical_marker_genes'`

For example, if the user specified the cell annotation as `broad_cells1`, then the name of the column in the pandas DataFrame will be `broad_cells1--canonical_marker_genes`.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--canonical_marker_genes
attributes.title: Canonical Marker Genes
attributes.values: Comma-separated string of gene names considered to be canonical markers for the biological entity used in the cell annotation.

attributes.description:
The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'synonyms'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'synonyms'`

For example, if the user specified the cell annotation as `broad_cells1`, then the name of the column in the pandas DataFrame will be `broad_cells1--synonyms`.
attributes.example: neuroglial cell, glial cell, neuroglia; amacrine cell; FMB cell
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--synonyms
attributes.title: Synonyms
attributes.values: Comma-separated string of synonyms for values in `[cellannotation_setname]`. Abbreviations are acceptable.

attributes.description: The column name is the string prefix `[cellannotation_setname]--` concatenated with the string value `category_fullname`, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'category_fullname'`. This MUST be the full-length name for the biological entity, not an abbreviation.
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--category_fullname
attributes.title: Category Full Name
attributes.values: A single value of the category/parent term for the cell label value in `[cellannotation_setname]`.

attributes.description: The column name is the string prefix `[cellannotation_setname]--` concatenated with the string value `category_cell_ontology_exists`, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'category_cell_ontology_exists'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--category_cell_ontology_exists
attributes.title: Category Cell Ontology Exists
attributes.values: Boolean value in Python (either True or False).

attributes.description: The column name is the value `[cellannotation_setname]` concatenated with the string `'category_cell_ontology_term_id'` and two hyphens, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'category_cell_ontology_term_id'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--category_cell_ontology_term_id
attributes.title: Category Cell Ontology Term ID
attributes.values: [The ID from either the Cell Ontology](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cl) or from some ontology that extends it by classifying cell types under terms from the Cell Ontology.

attributes.description: The column name is the string prefix `[cellannotation_setname]--` concatenated with the string value `category_cell_ontology_term`, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'category_cell_ontology_term'`
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--category_cell_ontology_term
attributes.title: Category Cell Ontology Term
attributes.values: The human-readable name assigned to the value of `'category_cell_ontology_term_id'`.

attributes.description: The column name is the string prefix `[cellannotation_setname]--` concatenated with the string value `cell_ontology_assessment`, i.e. `[cellannotation_setname] + '--' + 'cell_ontology_assessment'`
attributes.example: Amacrine cell should have four child terms: glycinergic, GABAergic, GABAergic Glycinergic amacrine cells and non-GABAergic non-glycinergic amacrine cells, which then contain their corresponding child terms
attributes.name: obs.{cellannotation_setname}--cell_ontology_assessment
attributes.title: Cell Ontology Assessment
attributes.values: Free-text field for researchers to express disagreements with any aspect of the Cell Ontology for this cell annotation.

attributes.description: Description of the `cellannotation_set` created.
attributes.example: Cell annotations based on resolution broad clustering using the Leiden algorithm.
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.description
attributes.title: Description
attributes.values: This is free-text for collaborators and third-parties to understand the context/background for the creation of this cell annotation set.

attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.annotation_method
attributes.title: Annotation Method
attributes.values:
`'algorithmic'`, `'manual'`, or `'both'`

NOTE: If `'algorithmic'` or `'both'`, more details are required. If `'manual'`, the values in the following `'algorithm_'` and `'reference_'` fields will be `'NA'`.

attributes.description: The name of the algorithm used.
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.algorithm_name
attributes.title: Algorithm Name
attributes.values: Algorithm name or if 'manual' then `'NA'`

attributes.description: The string of the algorithm's version.
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.algorithm_version
attributes.title: Algorithm Version
attributes.values: Typically in the format `'[MAJOR].[MINOR]'`, but other versioning systems are permitted based on the algorithm's versioning. `'NA'` if manual.

attributes.description: The string of the URL of the version control repository associated with the algorithm used (if applicable).
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.algorithm_repo_url
attributes.title: Algorithm Repository URL
attributes.values: It MUST be a string of a valid URL. `'NA'` if manual.

attributes.description: The string of the URL pointing to the reference dataset.
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.reference_location
attributes.title: Reference Location
attributes.values: Free-text URL pointing to the reference. `'NA'` if manual.

attributes.description: Free-text description of the reference used for automated annotation for this cell annotation set.
attributes.example: Tabula Muris Senis: a single cell transcriptomic atlas across the life span of Mus musculus which includes data from 18 tissues and organs.;NA
attributes.name: uns.{cellannotation_setname}.reference_description
attributes.title: Reference Description
attributes.values: Users are welcome to write out context which may be useful for other researchers. `'NA'` if manual.
